input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: ServiceNowActor.

Sample items Xml:
<items> <proxy-settings> <host>10.128.1.2</host> <port>808</port> <user-name>test</user-name> <password>test</password> </proxy-settings> <item> <connection-parameters> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password>admin</password> </connection-parameters> <incident-number>INC00011</incident-number> <change-number>CRQ000011</change-number> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
proxy-settings[Optional] - Parent tag that contains proxy server information. This is a child of "items" tag.
Following tags are valid only if "proxy-settings" is provided.
host[Conditional] - IP or hostname of proxy server. This is required if "proxy-settings" is provided.
port[Conditional] - Port on which the proxy server is listening for requests. This is required if "proxy-settings" is provided.
user-name[Optional] - Username required to authenticate against the proxy server.
password[Optional] - Password required to authenticate against the proxy server. Password can be encrypted by specifying the encryption type attribute. For example: <password encryption-type = "Base64">cGFzc3dvcmQ=</password>
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
connection-parameters [Optional]: It is parent tag of 'username' and 'password'. It is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration.
user-name [Optional]: Valid value: Username to be used to execute the request.
Note: Required if <connection-parameters> tag is specified in request.
password [Optional]: Valid value: Password to be used to execute the request. Password can be encrypted by specifying the encryption type attribute. For example: <password encryption-type = "Base64">cGFzc3dvcmQ=</password>
Note: Required if <connection-parameters> tag is specified in request.

output.description: Returned adapter response is captured in this context parameter.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <xsl:copy-of select="//proxy-settings" /> <item> <xsl:copy-of select="//connection-parameters" /> <number> <xsl:value-of select="string(//change-number)" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </number> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <xsl:copy-of select="//proxy-settings" /> <item> <xsl:copy-of select="//connection-parameters" /> <query> <number> <xsl:value-of select="string(//incident-number)" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </number> </query> <update> <rfc>${sys id}</rfc> </update> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
Create Incident
This wrapper creates an incident.
